descriptionSet.description: Amitabh Bachchan is depicted with a gun and dressed in a torn kurta (Indian style shirt) on the banks of the river Ganges.

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: A mighty drama as pure and powerful as the Ganga.
text-en: Sultan Ahmed's Ganga Ki Saugand Eastmancolor
text-en: Music Kalyanji Anandji
description-en: Amitabh Bachchan is depicted with a gun and dressed in a torn kurta (Indian style shirt) on the banks of the river Ganges. (gs/sp)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: The costume underlines that the story is located in the village. It looks like a revenge and action film and was clearly made during the peak of the star’s position in the film industry. The lone actor’s anger dominates the poster and the tagline says “A mighty drama as pure and powerful as the Ganga.” There is hardly any other information available on the poster, other than the music director’s name as the film rides overwhelmingly on the star's popularity at this juncture. The poster displays Bachchan’s ability to move away from the urban warrior image consolidated in his other films and also places the film within the genre of the dacoit films still popular at that time. Ganga Ki Saugandh was a story about a vigilante figure of the soil. Almost all these different signals are available in the poster – the presence of the “complete actor” is articulated through clothing, through location which is made clear by the water in the background, and the theme of revenge presented through a combination of facial expression and the gun in Bachchan’s hand. (Ranjani Mazumdar) (gs)
